sector_narrative: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
description_narrative: The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) Special Appeal Mine Action 2011 supports: the preventative mine action/weapon contamination program (data gathering, mine risk reduction, education, surveys and clearance activities); and the physical rehabilitation program for mine victims. The initiative will: promote universal adherence to and full implementation of humanitarian law treaties designed to protect civilians from mines and explosive remnants of war (ERW); engaging in humanitarian diplomacy to encourage governments and the public to address the problems of mines and ERW; implementing preventative mine action activities to reduce mine/ERW accidents to the minimum possible; assisting first-aid and medical/surgical services treating victims of armed conflict, including victims of mines cluster munitions and ERW; operating and supporting physical rehabilitation services in conflict affected countries and helping victims of armed conflict, including victims of mines, cluster
